intro: Aiouea elegans, commonly known as the silverleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery-white pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow and red, often blooming in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Aiouea elegans is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a landscape plant.
